channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [CXF-6584] EncryptSignature is ignored
item.description:
I'm trying to write a client for this webservice:

https://rheaavs.element44.net/AvsMpsService_R1_Variante2.wsdl

The WSDL includes a WS-Security policy which specifies

<sp:EncryptSignature/>

However, this does not seem to work, in the created requests the signature is not encrypted. Here is an example of a request created by Apache CXF:

<soap:Header>
<Action xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/08/addressing"
xmlns:wsu="http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/01/oasis-200401-wss-wssecurity-utility-1.0.xsd"
wsu:Id="_87016533-0fb2-47f5-b5e4-ae89c6a81d13">HoleStatusReport</Action>

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: PS. This request was created by a current git version of 3.1.3, since 3.1.2 does not work with this WSDL because of CXF-6582
For reference, here is a working SOAP request generated by .Net

CXF is correct here according to my reading of the spec. EncryptSignature refers to encrypting the primary signature, and not the supporting signature:

"This boolean property specifies whether the signature MUST be encrypted. If the value is 'true', the
primary signature MUST be encrypted and any signature confirmation elements MUST also be encrypted."

It sounds like .Net has interpreted this to also include supporting signatures. I guess we could always add an additional JAX-WS property to cover this scenario...what do you think?

Colm.

Maybe it's more complicated. The message contains 2 supporting signatures – as you can see in the request I've just attached, which was generated with EncryptSignature removed.

Only one of them is encrypted with EncryptSignature enabled. I don't understand why.

Ok I merged a fix to CXF 3.1.x to also encrypt the supporting signatures. Please try + let me know if it works.

Colm.

Thanks! Well, yes and no... All 3 signatures are encrypted now and look fine, but my client still does not work, i.e., the server still returns an InvalidSecurity fault.

I need to do more debugging and may come back with another bug report, maybe.
